snippet: After fighter jets pounded militant targets in North Waziristan, the military announced that it had launched a “comprehensive operation” against militants in the region.
abstract: Pakistan launches major military operation against Pakistani Taliban and allied foreign militants at their main base in tribal belt along Afghan border; fighter jets pound suspected militant hide-outs in North Waziristan as prelude to offensive; move ends years of hesitation.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Peshawar, and Declan Walsh from Dublin. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud and Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Saba Imtiaz from Karachi, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: After fighter jets pounded militant targets in North Waziristan, the military announced that it had launched a “comprehensive operation” against militants in the region.

headline.main: Pakistan Military Wages Assault Against Militants
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Military Wages Assault Against Militants
